legs/O of/O a/O chestnut/O horse/O flashed/O by/O close/O to/O him/O,/O and/O Mahotin/PERSON passed/O at/O
a/O swift/O gallop/O./O Vronsky/O was/O touching/O the/O ground/O with/O one/O foot/O,/O and/O his/O
mare/O was/O sinking/O on/O that/O foot/O./O He/O just/O had/O time/O to/O free/O his/O leg/O when/O she/O
fell/O on/O one/O side/O,/O gasping/O painfully/O,/O and/O,/O making/O vain/O efforts/O to/O rise/O
with/O her/O delicate/O,/O soaking/O neck/O,/O she/O fluttered/O on/O the/O ground/O at/O his/O feet/O
like/O a/O shot/O bird/O./O The/O clumsy/O movement/O made/O by/O Vronsky/PERSON had/O broken/O her/O
back/O./O But/O that/O he/O only/O knew/O much/O later/O./O At/O that/O moment/O he/O knew/O only/O that/O
Mahotin/PERSON had/O flown/O swiftly/O by/O,/O while/O he/O stood/O staggering/O alone/O on/O the/O
muddy/O,/O motionless/O ground/O,/O and/O Frou-Frou/O lay/O gasping/O before/O him/O,/O bending/O
her/O head/O back/O and/O gazing/O at/O him/O with/O her/O exquisite/O eyes/O./O Still/O unable/O to/O
realize/O what/O had/O happened/O,/O Vronsky/PERSON tugged/O at/O his/O mare/O's/O reins/O./O Again/O she/O
struggled/O all/O over/O like/O a/O fish/O,/O and/O her/O shoulders/O setting/O the/O saddle/O
heaving/O,/O she/O rose/O on/O her/O front/O legs/O but/O unable/O to/O lift/O her/O back/O,/O she/O
quivered/O all/O over/O and/O again/O fell/O on/O her/O side/O./O With/O a/O face/O hideous/O with/O
passion/O,/O his/O lower/O jaw/O trembling/O,/O and/O his/O cheeks/O white/O,/O Vronsky/PERSON kicked/O
her/O with/O his/O heel/O in/O the/O stomach/O and/O again/O fell/O to/O tugging/O at/O the/O rein/O./O
She/O did/O not/O stir/O,/O but/O thrusting/O her/O nose/O into/O the/O ground/O,/O she/O simply/O
gazed/O at/O her/O master/O with/O her/O speaking/O eyes/O./O

``/OA/O--/Oa/O--/Oa/O!/O''/O groaned/O Vronsky/O,/O clutching/O at/O his/O head/O./O ``/OAh/O!/O what/O have/O I/O done/O!/O''/O
he/O cried/O./O ``/OThe/O race/O lost/O!/O And/O my/O fault/O!/O shameful/O,/O unpardonable/O!/O And/O the/O
poor/O darling/O,/O ruined/O mare/O!/O Ah/O!/O what/O have/O I/O done/O!/O''/O

A/O crowd/O of/O men/O,/O a/O doctor/O and/O his/O assistant/O,/O the/O officers/O of/O his/O
regiment/O,/O ran/O up/O to/O him/O./O To/O his/O misery/O he/O felt/O that/O he/O was/O whole/O and/O
unhurt/O./O The/O mare/O had/O broken/O her/O back/O,/O and/O it/O was/O decided/O to/O shoot/O her/O./O
Vronsky/O could/O not/O answer/O questions/O,/O could/O not/O speak/O to/O anyone/O./O He/O
turned/O,/O and/O without/O picking/O up/O his/O cap/O that/O had/O fallen/O off/O,/O walked/O away/O
from/O the/O race/O course/O,/O not/O knowing/O where/O he/O was/O going/O./O He/O felt/O utterly/O
wretched/O./O For/O the/O first/O time/O in/O his/O life/O he/O knew/O the/O bitterest/O sort/O of/O
misfortune/O,/O misfortune/O beyond/O remedy/O,/O and/O caused/O by/O his/O own/O fault/O./O

Yashvin/PERSON overtook/O him/O with/O his/O cap/O,/O and/O led/O him/O home/O,/O and/O half/O an/O hour/O
later/O Vronsky/PERSON had/O regained/O his/O self-possession/O./O But/O the/O memory/O of/O that/O
race/O remained/O for/O long/O in/O his/O heart/O,/O the/O cruelest/O and/O bitterest/O memory/O
of/O his/O life/O./O



Chapter/O 26/O


The/O external/O relations/O of/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON and/O his/O wife/O had/O
remained/O unchanged/O./O The/O sole/O difference/O lay/O in/O the/O fact/O that/O he/O was/O more/O
busily/O occupied/O than/O ever/O./O As/O in/O former/O years/O,/O at/O the/O beginning/O of/O the/O
spring/O he/O had/O gone/O to/O a/O foreign/O watering-place/O for/O the/O sake/O of/O his/O
health/O,/O deranged/O by/O the/O winter/O's/O work/O that/O every/O year/O grew/O heavier/O./O And/O
just/O as/O always/O he/O returned/O in/O July/O and/O at/O once/O fell/O to/O work/O as/O usual/O
with/O increased/O energy/O./O As/O usual/O,/O too/O,/O his/O wife/O had/O moved/O for/O the/O summer/O
to/O a/O villa/O out/O of/O town/O,/O while/O he/O remained/O in/O Petersburg/LOCATION./O From/O the/O date/O
of/O their/O conversation/O after/O the/O party/O at/O Princess/O Tverskaya/PERSON's/O he/O had/O
never/O spoken/O again/O to/O Anna/PERSON of/O his/O suspicions/O and/O his/O jealousies/O,/O and/O
that/O habitual/O tone/O of/O his/O bantering/O mimicry/O was/O the/O most/O convenient/O tone/O
possible/O for/O his/O present/O attitude/O to/O his/O wife/O./O He/O was/O a/O little/O colder/O to/O
his/O wife/O./O He/O simply/O seemed/O to/O be/O slightly/O displeased/O with/O her/O for/O that/O
first/O midnight/O conversation/O,/O which/O she/O had/O repelled/O./O In/O his/O attitude/O to/O
her/O there/O was/O a/O shade/O of/O vexation/O,/O but/O nothing/O more/O./O ``/OYou/O would/O not/O be/O
open/O with/O me/O,/O''/O he/O seemed/O to/O say/O,/O mentally/O addressing/O her/O;/O ``/Oso/O much/O the/O
worse/O for/O you/O./O Now/O you/O may/O beg/O as/O you/O please/O,/O but/O I/O wo/On't/O be/O open/O with/O
you/O./O So/O much/O the/O worse/O for/O you/O!/O''/O he/O said/O mentally/O,/O like/O a/O man/O who/O,/O after/O
vainly/O attempting/O to/O extinguish/O a/O fire/O,/O should/O fly/O in/O a/O rage/O with/O his/O
vain/O efforts/O and/O say/O,/O ``/OOh/O,/O very/O well/O then/O!/O you/O shall/O burn/O for/O this/O!/O''/O
This/O man/O,/O so/O subtle/O and/O astute/O in/O official/O life/O,/O did/O not/O realize/O all/O the/O
senselessness/O of/O such/O an/O attitude/O to/O his/O wife/O./O He/O did/O not/O realize/O it/O,/O
because/O it/O was/O too/O terrible/O to/O him/O to/O realize/O his/O actual/O position/O,/O and/O
he/O shut/O down/O and/O locked/O and/O sealed/O up/O in/O his/O heart/O that/O secret/O place/O
where/O lay/O hid/O his/O feelings/O towards/O his/O family/O,/O that/O is/O,/O his/O wife/O and/O
son/O./O He/O who/O had/O been/O such/O a/O careful/O father/O,/O had/O from/O the/O end/O of/O that/O
winter/O become/O peculiarly/O frigid/O to/O his/O son/O,/O and/O adopted/O to/O him/O just/O the/O
same/O bantering/O tone/O he/O used/O with/O his/O wife/O./O ``/OAha/O,/O young/O man/O!/O''/O was/O the/O
greeting/O with/O which/O he/O met/O him/O./O

Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON asserted/O and/O believed/O that/O he/O had/O never/O in/O any/O
previous/O year/O had/O so/O much/O official/O business/O as/O that/O year/O./O But/O he/O was/O not/O
aware/O that/O he/O sought/O work/O for/O himself/O that/O year/O,/O that/O this/O was/O one/O of/O
the/O means/O for/O keeping/O shut/O that/O secret/O place/O where/O lay/O hid/O his/O feelings/O
towards/O his/O wife/O and/O son/O and/O his/O thoughts/O about/O them/O,/O which/O became/O more/O
terrible/O the/O longer/O they/O lay/O there/O./O If/O anyone/O had/O had/O the/O right/O to/O ask/O
Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON what/O he/O thought/O of/O his/O wife/O's/O behavior/O,/O the/O mild/O
and/O peaceable/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON would/O have/O made/O no/O answer/O,/O but/O he/O
would/O have/O been/O greatly/O angered/O with/O any/O man/O who/O should/O question/O him/O on/O
that/O subject/O./O For/O this/O reason/O there/O positively/O came/O into/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON's/O face/O a/O look/O of/O haughtiness/O and/O severity/O whenever/O anyone/O
inquired/O after/O his/O wife/O's/O health/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON did/O not/O want/O to/O
think/O at/O all/O about/O his/O wife/O's/O behavior/O,/O and/O he/O actually/O succeeded/O in/O not/O
thinking/O about/O it/O at/O all/O./O

Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON's/O permanent/O summer/O villa/O was/O in/O Peterhof/O,/O and/O the/O
Countess/O Lidia/PERSON Ivanovna/PERSON used/O as/O a/O rule/O to/O spend/O the/O summer/O there/O,/O close/O
to/O Anna/PERSON,/O and/O constantly/O seeing/O her/O./O That/O year/O Countess/O Lidia/PERSON Ivanovna/PERSON
declined/O to/O settle/O in/O Peterhof/O,/O was/O not/O once/O at/O Anna/PERSON Arkadyevna/PERSON's/O,/O and/O
in/O conversation/O with/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON hinted/O at/O the/O unsuitability/O
of/O Anna/PERSON's/O close/O intimacy/O with/O Betsy/PERSON and/O Vronsky/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON
sternly/O cut/O her/O short/O,/O roundly/O declaring/O his/O wife/O to/O be/O above/O suspicion/O,/O
and/O from/O that/O time/O began/O to/O avoid/O Countess/O Lidia/PERSON Ivanovna/PERSON./O He/O did/O not/O
want/O to/O see/O,/O and/O did/O not/O see/O,/O that/O many/O people/O in/O society/O cast/O dubious/O
glances/O on/O his/O wife/O;/O he/O did/O not/O want/O to/O understand/O,/O and/O did/O not/O
understand/O,/O why/O his/O wife/O had/O so/O particularly/O insisted/O on/O staying/O at/O
Tsarskoe/LOCATION,/O where/O Betsy/PERSON was/O staying/O,/O and/O not/O far/O from/O the/O camp/O of/O
Vronsky/O's/O regiment/O./O He/O did/O not/O allow/O himself/O to/O think/O about/O it/O,/O and/O he/O
did/O not/O think/O about/O it/O;/O but/O all/O the/O same/O though/O he/O never/O admitted/O it/O to/O
himself/O,/O and/O had/O no/O proofs/O,/O not/O even/O suspicious/O evidence/O,/O in/O the/O bottom/O
of/O his/O heart/O he/O knew/O beyond/O all/O doubt/O that/O he/O was/O a/O deceived/O husband/O,/O
and/O he/O was/O profoundly/O miserable/O about/O it/O./O

How/O often/O during/O those/O eight/O years/O of/O happy/O life/O with/O his/O wife/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O looked/O at/O other/O men/O's/O faithless/O wives/O and/O other/O
deceived/O husbands/O and/O asked/O himself/O:/O ``/OHow/O can/O people/O descend/O to/O that/O?/O
how/O is/O it/O they/O do/On't/O put/O an/O end/O to/O such/O a/O hideous/O position/O?/O''/O But/O now/O,/O
when/O the/O misfortune/O had/O come/O upon/O himself/O,/O he/O was/O so/O far/O from/O thinking/O
of/O putting/O an/O end/O to/O the/O position/O that/O he/O would/O not/O recognize/O it/O at/O all/O,/O
would/O not/O recognize/O it/O just/O because/O it/O was/O too/O awful/O,/O too/O unnatural/O./O

Since/O his/O return/O from/O abroad/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O twice/O been/O at/O
their/O country/O villa/O./O Once/O he/O dined/O there/O,/O another/O time/O he/O spent/O the/O
evening/O there/O with/O a/O party/O of/O friends/O,/O but/O he/O had/O not/O once/O stayed/O the/O
night/O there/O,/O as/O it/O had/O been/O his/O habit/O to/O do/O in/O previous/O years/O./O

The/O day/O of/O the/O races/O had/O been/O a/O very/O busy/O day/O for/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON;/O
but/O when/O mentally/O sketching/O out/O the/O day/O in/O the/O morning/O,/O he/O made/O up/O his/O
mind/O to/O go/O to/O their/O country/O house/O to/O see/O his/O wife/O immediately/O after/O
dinner/O,/O and/O from/O there/O to/O the/O races/O,/O which/O all/O the/O Court/O were/O to/O
witness/O,/O and/O at/O which/O he/O was/O bound/O to/O be/O present/O./O He/O was/O going/O to/O see/O
his/O wife/O,/O because/O he/O had/O determined/O to/O see/O her/O once/O a/O week/O to/O keep/O up/O
appearances/O./O And/O besides/O,/O on/O that/O day/O,/O as/O it/O was/O the/O fifteenth/O,/O he/O had/O
to/O give/O his/O wife/O some/O money/O for/O her/O expenses/O,/O according/O to/O their/O usual/O
arrangement/O./O

With/O his/O habitual/O control/O over/O his/O thoughts/O,/O though/O he/O thought/O all/O this/O
about/O his/O wife/O,/O he/O did/O not/O let/O his/O thoughts/O stray/O further/O in/O regard/O to/O
her/O./O

That/O morning/O was/O a/O very/O full/O one/O for/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON./O The/O evening/O
before/O,/O Countess/O Lidia/PERSON Ivanovna/PERSON had/O sent/O him/O a/O pamphlet/O by/O a/O celebrated/O
traveler/O in/O China/LOCATION,/O who/O was/O staying/O in/O Petersburg/LOCATION,/O and/O with/O it/O she/O
enclosed/O a/O note/O begging/O him/O to/O see/O the/O traveler/O himself/O,/O as/O he/O was/O an/O
extremely/O interesting/O person/O from/O various/O points/O of/O view/O,/O and/O likely/O to/O
be/O useful/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O not/O had/O time/O to/O read/O the/O pamphlet/O
through/O in/O the/O evening/O,/O and/O finished/O it/O in/O the/O morning/O./O Then/O people/O
began/O arriving/O with/O petitions/O,/O and/O there/O came/O the/O reports/O,/O interviews/O,/O
appointments/O,/O dismissals/O,/O apportionment/O of/O rewards/O,/O pensions/O,/O grants/O,/O
notes/O,/O the/O workaday/O round/O,/O as/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON called/O it/O,/O that/O
always/O took/O up/O so/O much/O time/O./O Then/O there/O was/O private/O business/O of/O his/O own/O,/O
a/O visit/O from/O the/O doctor/O and/O the/O steward/O who/O managed/O his/O property/O./O The/O
steward/O did/O not/O take/O up/O much/O time/O./O He/O simply/O gave/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON
the/O money/O he/O needed/O together/O with/O a/O brief/O statement/O of/O the/O position/O of/O
his/O affairs/O,/O which/O was/O not/O altogether/O satisfactory/O,/O as/O it/O had/O happened/O
that/O during/O that/O year/O,/O owing/O to/O increased/O expenses/O,/O more/O had/O been/O paid/O
out/O than/O usual/O,/O and/O there/O was/O a/O deficit/O./O But/O the/O doctor/O,/O a/O celebrated/O
Petersburg/LOCATION doctor/O,/O who/O was/O an/O intimate/O acquaintance/O of/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON,/O took/O up/O a/O great/O deal/O of/O time/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O
not/O expected/O him/O that/O day/O,/O and/O was/O surprised/O at/O his/O visit/O,/O and/O still/O
more/O so/O when/O the/O doctor/O questioned/O him/O very/O carefully/O about/O his/O health/O,/O
listened/O to/O his/O breathing/O,/O and/O tapped/O at/O his/O liver/O./O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON did/O not/O know/O that/O his/O friend/O Lidia/PERSON Ivanovna/PERSON,/O noticing/O
that/O he/O was/O not/O as/O well/O as/O usual/O that/O year/O,/O had/O begged/O the/O doctor/O to/O go/O
and/O examine/O him/O./O ``/ODo/O this/O for/O my/O sake/O,/O''/O the/O Countess/O Lidia/PERSON Ivanovna/PERSON had/O
said/O to/O him/O./O

``/OI/O will/O do/O it/O for/O the/O sake/O of/O Russia/LOCATION,/O countess/O,/O''/O replied/O the/O doctor/O./O

``/OA/O priceless/O man/O!/O''/O said/O the/O Countess/O Lidia/PERSON Ivanovna/PERSON./O

The/O doctor/O was/O extremely/O dissatisfied/O with/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON./O He/O
found/O the/O liver/O considerably/O enlarged/O,/O and/O the/O digestive/O powers/O
weakened/O,/O while/O the/O course/O of/O mineral/O waters/O had/O been/O quite/O without/O
effect/O./O He/O prescribed/O more/O physical/O exercise/O as/O far/O as/O possible/O,/O and/O as/O
far/O as/O possible/O less/O mental/O strain/O,/O and/O above/O all/O no/O worry/O--/Oin/O other/O
words/O,/O just/O what/O was/O as/O much/O out/O of/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON's/O power/O as/O
abstaining/O from/O breathing/O./O Then/O he/O withdrew/O,/O leaving/O in/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON an/O unpleasant/O sense/O that/O something/O was/O wrong/O with/O him/O,/O
and/O that/O there/O was/O no/O chance/O of/O curing/O it/O./O

As/O he/O was/O coming/O away/O,/O the/O doctor/O chanced/O to/O meet/O on/O the/O staircase/O an/O
acquaintance/O of/O his/O,/O Sludin/PERSON,/O who/O was/O secretary/O of/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON's/O department/O./O They/O had/O been/O comrades/O at/O the/O university/O,/O
and/O though/O they/O rarely/O met/O,/O they/O thought/O highly/O of/O each/O other/O and/O were/O
excellent/O friends/O,/O and/O so/O there/O was/O no/O one/O to/O whom/O the/O doctor/O would/O have/O
given/O his/O opinion/O of/O a/O patient/O so/O freely/O as/O to/O Sludin/LOCATION./O

``/OHow/O glad/O I/O am/O you/O've/O been/O seeing/O him/O!/O''/O said/O Sludin/PERSON./O ``/OHe/O's/O not/O well/O,/O and/O
I/O fancy/O.../O./O Well/O,/O what/O do/O you/O think/O of/O him/O?/O''/O

``/OI/O'll/O tell/O you/O,/O''/O said/O the/O doctor/O,/O beckoning/O over/O Sludin/PERSON's/O head/O to/O his/O
coachman/O to/O bring/O the/O carriage/O round/O./O ``/OIt/O's/O just/O this/O,/O''/O said/O the/O doctor/O,/O
taking/O a/O finger/O of/O his/O kid/O glove/O in/O his/O white/O hands/O and/O pulling/O it/O,/O ``/Oif/O
you/O do/On't/O strain/O the/O strings/O,/O and/O then/O try/O to/O break/O them/O,/O you/O'll/O find/O it/O
a/O difficult/O job/O;/O but/O strain/O a/O string/O to/O its/O very/O utmost/O,/O and/O the/O mere/O
weight/O of/O one/O finger/O on/O the/O strained/O string/O will/O snap/O it/O./O And/O with/O his/O
close/O assiduity/O,/O his/O conscientious/O devotion/O to/O his/O work/O,/O he/O's/O strained/O
to/O the/O utmost/O;/O and/O there/O's/O some/O outside/O burden/O weighing/O on/O him/O,/O and/O not/O
a/O light/O one/O,/O''/O concluded/O the/O doctor/O,/O raising/O his/O eyebrows/O significantly/O./O
``/OWill/O you/O be/O at/O the/O races/O?/O''/O he/O added/O,/O as/O he/O sank/O into/O his/O seat/O in/O the/O
carriage/O./O

``/OYes/O,/O yes/O,/O to/O be/O sure/O;/O it/O does/O waste/O a/O lot/O of/O time/O,/O''/O the/O doctor/O
responded/O vaguely/O to/O some/O reply/O of/O Sludin/PERSON's/O he/O had/O not/O caught/O./O

Directly/O after/O the/O doctor/O,/O who/O had/O taken/O up/O so/O much/O time/O,/O came/O the/O
celebrated/O traveler/O,/O and/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON,/O by/O means/O of/O the/O pamphlet/O
he/O had/O only/O just/O finished/O reading/O and/O his/O previous/O acquaintance/O with/O the/O
subject/O,/O impressed/O the/O traveler/O by/O the/O depth/O of/O his/O knowledge/O of/O the/O
subject/O and/O the/O breadth/O and/O enlightenment/O of/O his/O view/O of/O it/O./O

At/O the/O same/O time/O as/O the/O traveler/O there/O was/O announced/O a/O provincial/O
marshal/O of/O nobility/O on/O a/O visit/O to/O Petersburg/LOCATION,/O with/O whom/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O to/O have/O some/O conversation/O./O After/O his/O departure/O,/O he/O
had/O to/O finish/O the/O daily/O routine/O of/O business/O with/O his/O secretary/O,/O and/O then/O
he/O still/O had/O to/O drive/O round/O to/O call/O on/O a/O certain/O great/O personage/O on/O a/O
matter/O of/O grave/O and/O serious/O import/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON only/O just/O
managed/O to/O be/O back/O by/O five/O o'clock/O,/O his/O dinner-hour/O,/O and/O after/O dining/O
with/O his/O secretary/O,/O he/O invited/O him/O to/O drive/O with/O him/O to/O his/O country/O
villa/O and/O to/O the/O races/O./O

Though/O he/O did/O not/O acknowledge/O it/O to/O himself/O,/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON
always/O tried/O nowadays/O to/O secure/O the/O presence/O of/O a/O third/O person/O in/O his/O
interviews/O with/O his/O wife/O./O



Chapter/O 27/O


Anna/PERSON was/O upstairs/O,/O standing/O before/O the/O looking/O glass/O,/O and/O,/O with/O
Annushka/PERSON's/O assistance/O,/O pinning/O the/O last/O ribbon/O on/O her/O gown/O when/O she/O
heard/O carriage/O wheels/O crunching/O the/O gravel/O at/O the/O entrance/O./O

``/OIt/O's/O too/O early/O for/O Betsy/PERSON,/O''/O she/O thought/O,/O and/O glancing/O out/O of/O the/O window/O
she/O caught/O sight/O of/O the/O carriage/O and/O the/O black/O hat/O of/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON,/O and/O the/O ears/O that/O she/O knew/O so/O well/O sticking/O up/O each/O side/O
of/O it/O./O ``/OHow/O unlucky/O!/O Can/O he/O be/O going/O to/O stay/O the/O night/O?/O''/O she/O wondered/O,/O
and/O the/O thought/O of/O all/O that/O might/O come/O of/O such/O a/O chance/O struck/O her/O as/O so/O
awful/O and/O terrible/O that/O,/O without/O dwelling/O on/O it/O for/O a/O moment/O,/O she/O went/O
down/O to/O meet/O him/O with/O a/O bright/O and/O radiant/O face/O;/O and/O conscious/O of/O the/O
presence/O of/O that/O spirit/O of/O falsehood/O and/O deceit/O in/O herself/O that/O she/O had/O
come/O to/O know/O of/O late/O,/O she/O abandoned/O herself/O to/O that/O spirit/O and/O began/O
talking/O,/O hardly/O knowing/O what/O she/O was/O saying/O./O

``/OAh/O,/O how/O nice/O of/O you/O!/O''/O she/O said/O,/O giving/O her/O husband/O her/O hand/O,/O and/O
greeting/O Sludin/PERSON,/O who/O was/O like/O one/O of/O the/O family/O,/O with/O a/O smile/O./O ``/OYou/O're/O
staying/O the/O night/O,/O I/O hope/O?/O''/O was/O the/O first/O word/O the/O spirit/O of/O falsehood/O
prompted/O her/O to/O utter/O;/O ``/Oand/O now/O we/O'll/O go/O together/O./O Only/O it/O's/O a/O pity/O I/O've/O
promised/O Betsy/PERSON./O She/O's/O coming/O for/O me/O./O''/O

Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON knit/O his/O brows/O at/O Betsy/PERSON's/O name/O./O

``/OOh/O,/O I/O'm/O not/O going/O to/O separate/O the/O inseparables/O,/O''/O he/O said/O in/O his/O usual/O
bantering/O tone/O./O ``/OI/O'm/O going/O with/O Mihail/PERSON Vassilievitch/PERSON./O I/O'm/O ordered/O
exercise/O by/O the/O doctors/O too/O./O I/O'll/O walk/O,/O and/O fancy/O myself/O at/O the/O springs/O
again/O./O''/O

``/OThere/O's/O no/O hurry/O,/O''/O said/O Anna/PERSON./O ``/OWould/O you/O like/O tea/O?/O''/O

She/O rang/O./O

``/OBring/O in/O tea/O,/O and/O tell/O Seryozha/PERSON that/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON is/O here/O./O
Well/O,/O tell/O me/O,/O how/O have/O you/O been/O?/O Mihail/PERSON Vassilievitch/PERSON,/O you/O've/O not/O been/O
to/O see/O me/O before/O./O Look/O how/O lovely/O it/O is/O out/O on/O the/O terrace/O,/O''/O she/O said/O,/O
turning/O first/O to/O one/O and/O then/O to/O the/O other/O./O

She/O spoke/O very/O simply/O and/O naturally/O,/O but/O too/O much/O and/O too/O fast/O./O She/O was/O
the/O more/O aware/O of/O this/O from/O noticing/O in/O the/O inquisitive/O look/O Mihail/PERSON
Vassilievitch/PERSON turned/O on/O her/O that/O he/O was/O,/O as/O it/O were/O,/O keeping/O watch/O on/O
her/O./O

Mihail/PERSON Vassilievitch/PERSON promptly/O went/O out/O on/O the/O terrace/O./O

She/O sat/O down/O beside/O her/O husband/O./O

``/OYou/O do/On't/O look/O quite/O well/O,/O''/O she/O said/O./O

``/OYes/O,/O''/O he/O said/O;/O ``/Othe/O doctor/O's/O been/O with/O me/O today/O and/O wasted/O an/O hour/O of/O
my/O time/O./O I/O feel/O that/O some/O one/O of/O our/O friends/O must/O have/O sent/O him/O:/O my/O
health/O's/O so/O precious/O,/O it/O seems/O./O''/O

``/ONo/O;/O what/O did/O he/O say/O?/O''/O

She/O questioned/O him/O about/O his/O health/O and/O what/O he/O had/O been/O doing/O,/O and/O
tried/O to/O persuade/O him/O to/O take/O a/O rest/O and/O come/O out/O to/O her/O./O

All/O this/O she/O said/O brightly/O,/O rapidly/O,/O and/O with/O a/O peculiar/O brilliance/O in/O
her/O eyes/O./O But/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON did/O not/O now/O attach/O any/O special/O
significance/O to/O this/O tone/O of/O hers/O./O He/O heard/O only/O her/O words/O and/O gave/O them/O
only/O the/O direct/O sense/O they/O bore/O./O And/O he/O answered/O simply/O,/O though/O
jestingly/O./O There/O was/O nothing/O remarkable/O in/O all/O this/O conversation/O,/O but/O
never/O after/O could/O Anna/PERSON recall/O this/O brief/O scene/O without/O an/O agonizing/O pang/O
of/O shame/O./O

Seryozha/PERSON came/O in/O preceded/O by/O his/O governess/O./O If/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O
allowed/O himself/O to/O observe/O he/O would/O have/O noticed/O the/O timid/O and/O
bewildered/O eyes/O with/O which/O Seryozha/PERSON glanced/O first/O at/O his/O father/O and/O then/O
at/O his/O mother/O./O But/O he/O would/O not/O see/O anything/O,/O and/O he/O did/O not/O see/O it/O./O

``/OAh/O,/O the/O young/O man/O!/O He/O's/O grown/O./O Really/O,/O he/O's/O getting/O quite/O a/O man/O./O How/O
are/O you/O,/O young/O man/O?/O''/O

And/O he/O gave/O his/O hand/O to/O the/O scared/O child/O./O Seryozha/PERSON had/O been/O shy/O of/O his/O
father/O before/O,/O and/O now/O,/O ever/O since/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O taken/O to/O
calling/O him/O young/O man/O,/O and/O since/O that/O insoluble/O question/O had/O occurred/O to/O
him/O whether/O Vronsky/O were/O a/O friend/O or/O a/O foe/O,/O he/O avoided/O his/O father/O./O He/O
looked/O round/O towards/O his/O mother/O as/O though/O seeking/O shelter/O./O It/O was/O only/O
with/O his/O mother/O that/O he/O was/O at/O ease/O./O Meanwhile/O,/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON
was/O holding/O his/O son/O by/O the/O shoulder/O while/O he/O was/O speaking/O to/O the/O
governess/O,/O and/O Seryozha/PERSON was/O so/O miserably/O uncomfortable/O that/O Anna/PERSON saw/O he/O
was/O on/O the/O point/O of/O tears/O./O

Anna/PERSON,/O who/O had/O flushed/O a/O little/O the/O instant/O her/O son/O came/O in/O,/O noticing/O
that/O Seryozha/PERSON was/O uncomfortable/O,/O got/O up/O hurriedly/O,/O took/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON's/O hand/O from/O her/O son/O's/O shoulder/O,/O and/O kissing/O the/O boy/O,/O led/O
him/O out/O onto/O the/O terrace/O,/O and/O quickly/O came/O back/O./O

``/OIt/O's/O time/O to/O start/O,/O though/O,/O''/O said/O she/O,/O glancing/O at/O her/O watch/O./O ``/OHow/O is/O
it/O Betsy/PERSON does/On't/O come/O?/O.../O''/O

``/OYes/O,/O''/O said/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON,/O and/O getting/O up/O,/O he/O folded/O his/O hands/O
and/O cracked/O his/O fingers/O./O ``/OI/O've/O come/O to/O bring/O you/O some/O money/O,/O too/O,/O for/O
nightingales/O,/O we/O know/O,/O ca/On't/O live/O on/O fairy/O tales/O,/O''/O he/O said/O./O ``/OYou/O want/O
it/O,/O I/O expect/O?/O''/O

``/ONo/O,/O I/O do/On't/O .../O yes/O,/O I/O do/O,/O''/O she/O said/O,/O not/O looking/O at/O him/O,/O and/O
crimsoning/O to/O the/O roots/O of/O her/O hair/O./O ``/OBut/O you/O'll/O come/O back/O here/O after/O
the/O races/O,/O I/O suppose/O?/O''/O

``/OOh/O,/O yes/O!/O''/O answered/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON./O ``/OAnd/O here/O's/O the/O glory/O of/O
Peterhof/O,/O Princess/O Tverskaya/O,/O''/O he/O added/O,/O looking/O out/O of/O the/O window/O at/O
the/O elegant/O English/O carriage/O with/O the/O tiny/O seats/O placed/O extremely/O high/O./O
``/OWhat/O elegance/O!/O Charming/O!/O Well/O,/O let/O us/O be/O starting/O too/O,/O then/O./O''/O

Princess/O Tverskaya/PERSON did/O not/O get/O out/O of/O her/O carriage/O,/O but/O her/O groom/O,/O in/O
high/O boots/O,/O a/O cape/O,/O and/O black/O hat/O,/O darted/O out/O at/O the/O entrance/O./O

``/OI/O'm/O going/O;/O good-bye/O!/O''/O said/O Anna/PERSON,/O and/O kissing/O her/O son/O,/O she/O went/O up/O to/O
Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON and/O held/O out/O her/O hand/O to/O him/O./O ``/OIt/O was/O ever/O so/O nice/O
of/O you/O to/O come/O./O''/O

Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON kissed/O her/O hand/O./O

``/OWell/O,/O _/Oau/O revoir/O_/O,/O then/O!/O You/O'll/O come/O back/O for/O some/O tea/O;/O that/O's/O
delightful/O!/O''/O she/O said/O,/O and/O went/O out/O,/O gay/O and/O radiant/O./O But/O as/O soon/O as/O she/O
no/O longer/O saw/O him/O,/O she/O was/O aware/O of/O the/O spot/O on/O her/O hand/O that/O his/O lips/O
had/O touched/O,/O and/O she/O shuddered/O with/O repulsion/O./O



Chapter/O 28/O


When/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON reached/O the/O race-course/O,/O Anna/PERSON was/O already/O
sitting/O in/O the/O pavilion/O beside/O Betsy/PERSON,/O in/O that/O pavilion/O where/O all/O the/O
highest/O society/O had/O gathered/O./O She/O caught/O sight/O of/O her/O husband/O in/O the/O
distance/O./O Two/O men/O,/O her/O husband/O and/O her/O lover/O,/O were/O the/O two/O centers/O of/O
her/O existence/O,/O and/O unaided/O by/O her/O external/O senses/O she/O was/O aware/O of/O their/O
nearness/O./O She/O was/O aware/O of/O her/O husband/O approaching/O a/O long/O way/O off/O,/O and/O
she/O could/O not/O help/O following/O him/O in/O the/O surging/O crowd/O in/O the/O midst/O of/O
which/O he/O was/O moving/O./O She/O watched/O his/O progress/O towards/O the/O pavilion/O,/O saw/O
him/O now/O responding/O condescendingly/O to/O an/O ingratiating/O bow/O,/O now/O
exchanging/O friendly/O,/O nonchalant/O greetings/O with/O his/O equals/O,/O now/O
assiduously/O trying/O to/O catch/O the/O eye/O of/O some/O great/O one/O of/O this/O world/O,/O and/O
taking/O off/O his/O big/O round/O hat/O that/O squeezed/O the/O tips/O of/O his/O ears/O./O All/O
these/O ways/O of/O his/O she/O knew/O,/O and/O all/O were/O hateful/O to/O her/O./O ``/ONothing/O but/O
ambition/O,/O nothing/O but/O the/O desire/O to/O get/O on/O,/O that/O's/O all/O there/O is/O in/O his/O
soul/O,/O''/O she/O thought/O;/O ``/Oas/O for/O these/O lofty/O ideals/O,/O love/O of/O culture/O,/O
religion/O,/O they/O are/O only/O so/O many/O tools/O for/O getting/O on/O./O''/O

From/O his/O glances/O towards/O the/O ladies/O'/O pavilion/O -LRB-/Ohe/O was/O staring/O straight/O
at/O her/O,/O but/O did/O not/O distinguish/O his/O wife/O in/O the/O sea/O of/O muslin/O,/O ribbons/O,/O
feathers/O,/O parasols/O and/O flowers/O-RRB-/O she/O saw/O that/O he/O was/O looking/O for/O her/O,/O but/O
she/O purposely/O avoided/O noticing/O him/O./O

``/OAlexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON!/O''/O Princess/O Betsy/PERSON called/O to/O him/O;/O ``/OI/O'm/O sure/O you/O
do/On't/O see/O your/O wife/O:/O here/O she/O is/O./O''/O

He/O smiled/O his/O chilly/O smile/O./O

``/OThere/O's/O so/O much/O splendor/O here/O that/O one/O's/O eyes/O are/O dazzled/O,/O''/O he/O said/O,/O
and/O he/O went/O into/O the/O pavilion/O./O He/O smiled/O to/O his/O wife/O as/O a/O man/O should/O
smile/O on/O meeting/O his/O wife/O after/O only/O just/O parting/O from/O her/O,/O and/O greeted/O
the/O princess/O and/O other/O acquaintances/O,/O giving/O to/O each/O what/O was/O due/O--/Othat/O
is/O to/O say/O,/O jesting/O with/O the/O ladies/O and/O dealing/O out/O friendly/O greetings/O
among/O the/O men/O./O Below/O,/O near/O the/O pavilion/O,/O was/O standing/O an/O
adjutant-general/O of/O whom/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O a/O high/O opinion/O,/O noted/O
for/O his/O intelligence/O and/O culture/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON entered/O into/O
conversation/O with/O him/O./O

There/O was/O an/O interval/O between/O the/O races/O,/O and/O so/O nothing/O hindered/O
conversation/O./O The/O adjutant-general/O expressed/O his/O disapproval/O of/O races/O./O
Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON replied/O defending/O them/O./O Anna/PERSON heard/O his/O high/O,/O
measured/O tones/O,/O not/O losing/O one/O word/O,/O and/O every/O word/O struck/O her/O as/O false/O,/O
and/O stabbed/O her/O ears/O with/O pain/O./O

When/O the/O three-mile/O steeplechase/O was/O beginning/O,/O she/O bent/O forward/O and/O
gazed/O with/O fixed/O eyes/O at/O Vronsky/O as/O he/O went/O up/O to/O his/O horse/O and/O mounted/O,/O
and/O at/O the/O same/O time/O she/O heard/O that/O loathsome/O,/O never-ceasing/O voice/O of/O
her/O husband/O./O She/O was/O in/O an/O agony/O of/O terror/O for/O Vronsky/O,/O but/O a/O still/O
greater/O agony/O was/O the/O never-ceasing/O,/O as/O it/O seemed/O to/O her/O,/O stream/O of/O her/O
husband/O's/O shrill/O voice/O with/O its/O familiar/O intonations/O./O

``/OI/O'm/O a/O wicked/O woman/O,/O a/O lost/O woman/O,/O''/O she/O thought/O;/O ``/Obut/O I/O do/On't/O like/O
lying/O,/O I/O ca/On't/O endure/O falsehood/O,/O while/O as/O for/O _/Ohim/O_/O -LRB-/Oher/O husband/O-RRB-/O it/O's/O
the/O breath/O of/O his/O life/O--/Ofalsehood/O./O He/O knows/O all/O about/O it/O,/O he/O sees/O it/O all/O;/O
what/O does/O he/O care/O if/O he/O can/O talk/O so/O calmly/O?/O If/O he/O were/O to/O kill/O me/O,/O if/O he/O
were/O to/O kill/O Vronsky/O,/O I/O might/O respect/O him/O./O No/O,/O all/O he/O wants/O is/O falsehood/O
and/O propriety/O,/O''/O Anna/PERSON said/O to/O herself/O,/O not/O considering/O exactly/O what/O it/O
was/O she/O wanted/O of/O her/O husband/O,/O and/O how/O she/O would/O have/O liked/O to/O see/O him/O
behave/O./O She/O did/O not/O understand/O either/O that/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON's/O
peculiar/O loquacity/O that/O day/O,/O so/O exasperating/O to/O her/O,/O was/O merely/O the/O
expression/O of/O his/O inward/O distress/O and/O uneasiness/O./O As/O a/O child/O that/O has/O
been/O hurt/O skips/O about/O,/O putting/O all/O his/O muscles/O into/O movement/O to/O drown/O
the/O pain/O,/O in/O the/O same/O way/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON needed/O mental/O exercise/O
to/O drown/O the/O thoughts/O of/O his/O wife/O that/O in/O her/O presence/O and/O in/O Vronsky/O's/O,/O
and/O with/O the/O continual/O iteration/O of/O his/O name/O,/O would/O force/O themselves/O on/O
his/O attention/O./O And/O it/O was/O as/O natural/O for/O him/O to/O talk/O well/O and/O cleverly/O,/O
as/O it/O is/O natural/O for/O a/O child/O to/O skip/O about/O./O He/O was/O saying/O:/O

``/ODanger/O in/O the/O races/O of/O officers/O,/O of/O cavalry/O men/O,/O is/O an/O essential/O
element/O in/O the/O race/O./O If/O England/LOCATION can/O point/O to/O the/O most/O brilliant/O feats/O of/O
cavalry/O in/O military/O history/O,/O it/O is/O simply/O owing/O to/O the/O fact/O that/O she/O has/O
historically/O developed/O this/O force/O both/O in/O beasts/O and/O in/O men/O./O Sport/O has/O,/O
in/O my/O opinion/O,/O a/O great/O value/O,/O and/O as/O is/O always/O the/O case/O,/O we/O see/O nothing/O
but/O what/O is/O most/O superficial/O./O''/O

``/OIt/O's/O not/O superficial/O,/O''/O said/O Princess/O Tverskaya/PERSON./O ``/OOne/O of/O the/O officers/O,/O
they/O say/O,/O has/O broken/O two/O ribs/O./O''/O

Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON smiled/O his/O smile/O,/O which/O uncovered/O his/O teeth/O,/O but/O
revealed/O nothing/O more/O./O

``/OWe/O'll/O admit/O,/O princess/O,/O that/O that/O's/O not/O superficial/O,/O''/O he/O said/O,/O ``/Obut/O
internal/O./O But/O that/O's/O not/O the/O point/O,/O''/O and/O he/O turned/O again/O to/O the/O general/O
with/O whom/O he/O was/O talking/O seriously/O;/O ``/Owe/O must/On't/O forget/O that/O those/O who/O
are/O taking/O part/O in/O the/O race/O are/O military/O men/O,/O who/O have/O chosen/O that/O
career/O,/O and/O one/O must/O allow/O that/O every/O calling/O has/O its/O disagreeable/O side/O./O
It/O forms/O an/O integral/O part/O of/O the/O duties/O of/O an/O officer/O./O Low/O sports/O,/O such/O
as/O prize-fighting/O or/O Spanish/O bull-fights/O,/O are/O a/O sign/O of/O barbarity/O./O But/O
specialized/O trials/O of/O skill/O are/O a/O sign/O of/O development/O./O''/O

``/ONo/O,/O I/O sha/On't/O come/O another/O time/O;/O it/O's/O too/O upsetting/O,/O''/O said/O Princess/O
Betsy/PERSON./O ``/OIs/On't/O it/O,/O Anna/PERSON?/O''/O

``/OIt/O is/O upsetting/O,/O but/O one/O ca/On't/O tear/O oneself/O away/O,/O''/O said/O another/O lady/O./O
``/OIf/O I/O'd/O been/O a/O Roman/O woman/O I/O should/O never/O have/O missed/O a/O single/O circus/O./O''/O

Anna/PERSON said/O nothing/O,/O and/O keeping/O her/O opera/O glass/O up/O,/O gazed/O always/O at/O the/O
same/O spot/O./O

At/O that/O moment/O a/O tall/O general/O walked/O through/O the/O pavilion/O./O Breaking/O off/O
what/O he/O was/O saying/O,/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON got/O up/O hurriedly/O,/O though/O with/O
dignity/O,/O and/O bowed/O low/O to/O the/O general/O./O

``/OYou/O're/O not/O racing/O?/O''/O the/O officer/O asked/O,/O chaffing/O him/O./O

``/OMy/O race/O is/O a/O harder/O one/O,/O''/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON responded/O
deferentially/O./O

And/O though/O the/O answer/O meant/O nothing/O,/O the/O general/O looked/O as/O though/O he/O had/O
heard/O a/O witty/O remark/O from/O a/O witty/O man/O,/O and/O fully/O relished/O _/Ola/O pointe/O de/O
la/O sauce/O_/O./O

``/OThere/O are/O two/O aspects/O,/O''/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON resumed/O:/O ``/Othose/O who/O take/O
part/O and/O those/O who/O look/O on/O;/O and/O love/O for/O such/O spectacles/O is/O an/O
unmistakable/O proof/O of/O a/O low/O degree/O of/O development/O in/O the/O spectator/O,/O I/O
admit/O,/O but/O.../O''/O

``/OPrincess/O,/O bets/O!/O''/O sounded/O Stepan/PERSON Arkadyevitch/PERSON's/O voice/O from/O below/O,/O
addressing/O Betsy/PERSON./O ``/OWho/O's/O your/O favorite/O?/O''/O

``/OAnna/PERSON and/O I/O are/O for/O Kuzovlev/PERSON,/O''/O replied/O Betsy/PERSON./O

``/OI/O'm/O for/O Vronsky/O./O A/O pair/O of/O gloves/O?/O''/O

``/ODone/O!/O''/O

``/OBut/O it/O is/O a/O pretty/O sight/O,/O is/On't/O it/O?/O''/O

Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON paused/O while/O there/O was/O talking/O about/O him/O,/O but/O he/O
began/O again/O directly/O./O

``/OI/O admit/O that/O manly/O sports/O do/O not/O.../O''/O he/O was/O continuing/O./O

But/O at/O that/O moment/O the/O racers/O started/O,/O and/O all/O conversation/O ceased/O./O
Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON too/O was/O silent/O,/O and/O everyone/O stood/O up/O and/O turned/O
towards/O the/O stream/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON took/O no/O interest/O in/O the/O race/O,/O
and/O so/O he/O did/O not/O watch/O the/O racers/O,/O but/O fell/O listlessly/O to/O scanning/O the/O
spectators/O with/O his/O weary/O eyes/O./O His/O eyes/O rested/O upon/O Anna/PERSON./O

Her/O face/O was/O white/O and/O set/O./O She/O was/O obviously/O seeing/O nothing/O and/O no/O one/O
but/O one/O man/O./O Her/O hand/O had/O convulsively/O clutched/O her/O fan/O,/O and/O she/O held/O
her/O breath/O./O He/O looked/O at/O her/O and/O hastily/O turned/O away/O,/O scrutinizing/O other/O
faces/O./O

``/OBut/O here/O's/O this/O lady/O too/O,/O and/O others/O very/O much/O moved/O as/O well/O;/O it/O's/O very/O
natural/O,/O''/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON told/O himself/O./O He/O tried/O not/O to/O look/O at/O
her/O,/O but/O unconsciously/O his/O eyes/O were/O drawn/O to/O her/O./O He/O examined/O that/O face/O
again/O,/O trying/O not/O to/O read/O what/O was/O so/O plainly/O written/O on/O it/O,/O and/O against/O
his/O own/O will/O,/O with/O horror/O read/O on/O it/O what/O he/O did/O not/O want/O to/O know/O./O

The/O first/O fall/O--/OKuzovlev/PERSON's/O,/O at/O the/O stream/O--/Oagitated/O everyone/O,/O but/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON saw/O distinctly/O on/O Anna/PERSON's/O pale/O,/O triumphant/O face/O that/O the/O
man/O she/O was/O watching/O had/O not/O fallen/O./O When/O,/O after/O Mahotin/PERSON and/O Vronsky/PERSON had/O
cleared/O the/O worst/O barrier/O,/O the/O next/O officer/O had/O been/O thrown/O straight/O on/O
his/O head/O at/O it/O and/O fatally/O injured/O,/O and/O a/O shudder/O of/O horror/O passed/O over/O
the/O whole/O public/O,/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON saw/O that/O Anna/PERSON did/O not/O even/O
notice/O it/O,/O and/O had/O some/O difficulty/O in/O realizing/O what/O they/O were/O talking/O
of/O about/O her/O./O But/O more/O and/O more/O often/O,/O and/O with/O greater/O persistence/O,/O he/O
watched/O her/O./O Anna/PERSON,/O wholly/O engrossed/O as/O she/O was/O with/O the/O race/O,/O became/O
aware/O of/O her/O husband/O's/O cold/O eyes/O fixed/O upon/O her/O from/O one/O side/O./O

She/O glanced/O round/O for/O an/O instant/O,/O looked/O inquiringly/O at/O him/O,/O and/O with/O a/O
slight/O frown/O turned/O away/O again/O./O

``/OAh/O,/O I/O do/On't/O care/O!/O''/O she/O seemed/O to/O say/O to/O him/O,/O and/O she/O did/O not/O once/O
glance/O at/O him/O again/O./O

The/O race/O was/O an/O unlucky/O one/O,/O and/O of/O the/O seventeen/O officers/O who/O rode/O in/O
it/O more/O than/O half/O were/O thrown/O and/O hurt/O./O Towards/O the/O end/O of/O the/O race/O
everyone/O was/O in/O a/O state/O of/O agitation/O,/O which/O was/O intensified/O by/O the/O fact/O
that/O the/O Tsar/O was/O displeased/O./O



Chapter/O 29/O


Everyone/O was/O loudly/O expressing/O disapprobation/O,/O everyone/O was/O repeating/O a/O
phrase/O some/O one/O had/O uttered/O--/O``/OThe/O lions/O and/O gladiators/O will/O be/O the/O next/O
thing/O,/O''/O and/O everyone/O was/O feeling/O horrified/O;/O so/O that/O when/O Vronsky/O fell/O to/O
the/O ground/O,/O and/O Anna/PERSON moaned/O aloud/O,/O there/O was/O nothing/O very/O out/O of/O the/O way/O
in/O it/O./O But/O afterwards/O a/O change/O came/O over/O Anna/PERSON's/O face/O which/O really/O was/O
beyond/O decorum/O./O She/O utterly/O lost/O her/O head/O./O She/O began/O fluttering/O like/O a/O
caged/O bird/O,/O at/O one/O moment/O would/O have/O got/O up/O and/O moved/O away/O,/O at/O the/O next/O
turned/O to/O Betsy/PERSON./O

``/OLet/O us/O go/O,/O let/O us/O go/O!/O''/O she/O said/O./O

But/O Betsy/PERSON did/O not/O hear/O her/O./O She/O was/O bending/O down/O,/O talking/O to/O a/O general/O
who/O had/O come/O up/O to/O her/O./O

Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON went/O up/O to/O Anna/PERSON and/O courteously/O offered/O her/O his/O
arm/O./O

``/OLet/O us/O go/O,/O if/O you/O like/O,/O''/O he/O said/O in/O French/O,/O but/O Anna/PERSON was/O listening/O to/O
the/O general/O and/O did/O not/O notice/O her/O husband/O./O

``/OHe/O's/O broken/O his/O leg/O too/O,/O so/O they/O say/O,/O''/O the/O general/O was/O saying/O./O ``/OThis/O is/O
beyond/O everything/O./O''/O

Without/O answering/O her/O husband/O,/O Anna/PERSON lifted/O her/O opera/O glass/O and/O gazed/O
towards/O the/O place/O where/O Vronsky/O had/O fallen/O;/O but/O it/O was/O so/O far/O off/O,/O and/O
there/O was/O such/O a/O crowd/O of/O people/O about/O it/O,/O that/O she/O could/O make/O out/O
nothing/O./O She/O laid/O down/O the/O opera/O glass/O,/O and/O would/O have/O moved/O away/O,/O but/O
at/O that/O moment/O an/O officer/O galloped/O up/O and/O made/O some/O announcement/O to/O the/O
Tsar/O./O Anna/PERSON craned/O forward/O,/O listening/O./O

``/OStiva/O!/O Stiva/O!/O''/O she/O cried/O to/O her/O brother/O./O

But/O her/O brother/O did/O not/O hear/O her/O./O Again/O she/O would/O have/O moved/O away/O./O

``/OOnce/O more/O I/O offer/O you/O my/O arm/O if/O you/O want/O to/O be/O going/O,/O''/O said/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON,/O reaching/O towards/O her/O hand/O./O

She/O drew/O back/O from/O him/O with/O aversion/O,/O and/O without/O looking/O in/O his/O face/O
answered/O:/O

``/ONo/O,/O no/O,/O let/O me/O be/O,/O I/O'll/O stay/O./O''/O

She/O saw/O now/O that/O from/O the/O place/O of/O Vronsky/O's/O accident/O an/O officer/O was/O
running/O across/O the/O course/O towards/O the/O pavilion/O./O Betsy/PERSON waved/O her/O
handkerchief/O to/O him/O./O The/O officer/O brought/O the/O news/O that/O the/O rider/O was/O not/O
killed/O,/O but/O the/O horse/O had/O broken/O its/O back/O./O

On/O hearing/O this/O Anna/PERSON sat/O down/O hurriedly/O,/O and/O hid/O her/O face/O in/O her/O fan/O./O
Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON saw/O that/O she/O was/O weeping/O,/O and/O could/O not/O control/O
her/O tears/O,/O nor/O even/O the/O sobs/O that/O were/O shaking/O her/O bosom/O./O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON stood/O so/O as/O to/O screen/O her/O,/O giving/O her/O time/O to/O recover/O
herself/O./O

``/OFor/O the/O third/O time/O I/O offer/O you/O my/O arm/O,/O''/O he/O said/O to/O her/O after/O a/O little/O
time/O,/O turning/O to/O her/O./O Anna/PERSON gazed/O at/O him/O and/O did/O not/O know/O what/O to/O say/O./O
Princess/O Betsy/PERSON came/O to/O her/O rescue/O./O

``/ONo/O,/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON;/O I/O brought/O Anna/PERSON and/O I/O promised/O to/O take/O her/O
home/O,/O''/O put/O in/O Betsy/PERSON./O

``/OExcuse/O me/O,/O princess/O,/O''/O he/O said/O,/O smiling/O courteously/O but/O looking/O her/O very/O
firmly/O in/O the/O face/O,/O ``/Obut/O I/O see/O that/O Anna/PERSON's/O not/O very/O well/O,/O and/O I/O wish/O her/O
to/O come/O home/O with/O me/O./O''/O

Anna/PERSON looked/O about/O her/O in/O a/O frightened/O way/O,/O got/O up/O submissively/O,/O and/O laid/O
her/O hand/O on/O her/O husband/O's/O arm/O./O

``/OI/O'll/O send/O to/O him/O and/O find/O out/O,/O and/O let/O you/O know/O,/O''/O Betsy/PERSON whispered/O to/O
her/O./O

As/O they/O left/O the/O pavilion/O,/O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON,/O as/O always/O,/O talked/O to/O
those/O he/O met/O,/O and/O Anna/PERSON had/O,/O as/O always/O,/O to/O talk/O and/O answer/O;/O but/O she/O was/O
utterly/O beside/O herself/O,/O and/O moved/O hanging/O on/O her/O husband/O's/O arm/O as/O though/O
in/O a/O dream/O./O

``/OIs/O he/O killed/O or/O not/O?/O Is/O it/O true/O?/O Will/O he/O come/O or/O not/O?/O Shall/O I/O see/O him/O
today/O?/O''/O she/O was/O thinking/O./O

She/O took/O her/O seat/O in/O her/O husband/O's/O carriage/O in/O silence/O,/O and/O in/O silence/O
drove/O out/O of/O the/O crowd/O of/O carriages/O./O In/O spite/O of/O all/O he/O had/O seen/O,/O Alexey/PERSON
Alexandrovitch/PERSON still/O did/O not/O allow/O himself/O to/O consider/O his/O wife/O's/O real/O
condition/O./O He/O merely/O saw/O the/O outward/O symptoms/O./O He/O saw/O that/O she/O was/O
behaving/O unbecomingly/O,/O and/O considered/O it/O his/O duty/O to/O tell/O her/O so/O./O But/O it/O
was/O very/O difficult/O for/O him/O not/O to/O say/O more/O,/O to/O tell/O her/O nothing/O but/O
that/O./O He/O opened/O his/O mouth/O to/O tell/O her/O she/O had/O behaved/O unbecomingly/O,/O but/O
he/O could/O not/O help/O saying/O something/O utterly/O different/O./O

``/OWhat/O an/O inclination/O we/O all/O have/O,/O though/O,/O for/O these/O cruel/O spectacles/O,/O''/O
he/O said/O./O ``/OI/O observe/O.../O''/O

``/OEh/O?/O I/O do/On't/O understand/O,/O''/O said/O Anna/PERSON contemptuously/O./O

He/O was/O offended/O,/O and/O at/O once/O began/O to/O say/O what/O he/O had/O meant/O to/O say/O./O

``/OI/O am/O obliged/O to/O tell/O you/O,/O''/O he/O began/O./O

``/OSo/O now/O we/O are/O to/O have/O it/O out/O,/O''/O she/O thought/O,/O and/O she/O felt/O frightened/O./O

``/OI/O am/O obliged/O to/O tell/O you/O that/O your/O behavior/O has/O been/O unbecoming/O today/O,/O''/O
he/O said/O to/O her/O in/O French/O./O

``/OIn/O what/O way/O has/O my/O behavior/O been/O unbecoming/O?/O''/O she/O said/O aloud/O,/O turning/O
her/O head/O swiftly/O and/O looking/O him/O straight/O in/O the/O face/O,/O not/O with/O the/O
bright/O expression/O that/O seemed/O covering/O something/O,/O but/O with/O a/O look/O of/O
determination/O,/O under/O which/O she/O concealed/O with/O difficulty/O the/O dismay/O she/O
was/O feeling/O./O

``/OMind/O,/O''/O he/O said/O,/O pointing/O to/O the/O open/O window/O opposite/O the/O coachman/O./O

He/O got/O up/O and/O pulled/O up/O the/O window/O./O

``/OWhat/O did/O you/O consider/O unbecoming/O?/O''/O she/O repeated/O./O

``/OThe/O despair/O you/O were/O unable/O to/O conceal/O at/O the/O accident/O to/O one/O of/O the/O
riders/O./O''/O

He/O waited/O for/O her/O to/O answer/O,/O but/O she/O was/O silent/O,/O looking/O straight/O before/O
her/O./O

``/OI/O have/O already/O begged/O you/O so/O to/O conduct/O yourself/O in/O society/O that/O even/O
malicious/O tongues/O can/O find/O nothing/O to/O say/O against/O you/O./O There/O was/O a/O time/O
when/O I/O spoke/O of/O your/O inward/O attitude/O,/O but/O I/O am/O not/O speaking/O of/O that/O now/O./O
Now/O I/O speak/O only/O of/O your/O external/O attitude/O./O You/O have/O behaved/O improperly/O,/O
and/O I/O would/O wish/O it/O not/O to/O occur/O again/O./O''/O

She/O did/O not/O hear/O half/O of/O what/O he/O was/O saying/O;/O she/O felt/O panic-stricken/O
before/O him/O,/O and/O was/O thinking/O whether/O it/O was/O true/O that/O Vronsky/O was/O not/O
killed/O./O Was/O it/O of/O him/O they/O were/O speaking/O when/O they/O said/O the/O rider/O was/O
unhurt/O,/O but/O the/O horse/O had/O broken/O its/O back/O?/O She/O merely/O smiled/O with/O a/O
pretense/O of/O irony/O when/O he/O finished/O,/O and/O made/O no/O reply/O,/O because/O she/O had/O
not/O heard/O what/O he/O said/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON had/O begun/O to/O speak/O boldly/O,/O
but/O as/O he/O realized/O plainly/O what/O he/O was/O speaking/O of/O,/O the/O dismay/O she/O was/O
feeling/O infected/O him/O too/O./O He/O saw/O the/O smile/O,/O and/O a/O strange/O
misapprehension/O came/O over/O him/O./O

``/OShe/O is/O smiling/O at/O my/O suspicions/O./O Yes/O,/O she/O will/O tell/O me/O directly/O what/O
she/O told/O me/O before/O;/O that/O there/O is/O no/O foundation/O for/O my/O suspicions/O,/O that/O
it/O's/O absurd/O./O''/O

At/O that/O moment/O,/O when/O the/O revelation/O of/O everything/O was/O hanging/O over/O him/O,/O
there/O was/O nothing/O he/O expected/O so/O much/O as/O that/O she/O would/O answer/O mockingly/O
as/O before/O that/O his/O suspicions/O were/O absurd/O and/O utterly/O groundless/O./O So/O
terrible/O to/O him/O was/O what/O he/O knew/O that/O now/O he/O was/O ready/O to/O believe/O
anything/O./O But/O the/O expression/O of/O her/O face/O,/O scared/O and/O gloomy/O,/O did/O not/O now/O
promise/O even/O deception/O./O

``/OPossibly/O I/O was/O mistaken/O,/O''/O said/O he/O./O ``/OIf/O so/O,/O I/O beg/O your/O pardon/O./O''/O

``/ONo/O,/O you/O were/O not/O mistaken/O,/O''/O she/O said/O deliberately/O,/O looking/O desperately/O
into/O his/O cold/O face/O./O ``/OYou/O were/O not/O mistaken/O./O I/O was/O,/O and/O I/O could/O not/O help/O
being/O in/O despair/O./O I/O hear/O you/O,/O but/O I/O am/O thinking/O of/O him/O./O I/O love/O him/O,/O I/O am/O
his/O mistress/O;/O I/O ca/On't/O bear/O you/O;/O I/O'm/O afraid/O of/O you/O,/O and/O I/O hate/O you/O.../O./O
You/O can/O do/O what/O you/O like/O to/O me/O./O''/O

And/O dropping/O back/O into/O the/O corner/O of/O the/O carriage/O,/O she/O broke/O into/O sobs/O,/O
hiding/O her/O face/O in/O her/O hands/O./O Alexey/PERSON Alexandrovitch/PERSON did/O not/O stir/O,/O and/O
kept/O looking/O straight/O before/O him/O./O But/O his/O whole/O face/O suddenly/O bore/O the/O
solemn/O rigidity/O of/O the/O dead/O,/O and/O his/O expression/O did/O not/O change/O during/O
the/O whole/O time/O of/O the/O drive/O home/O./O On/O reaching/O the/O house/O he/O turned/O his/O
head/O to/O her/O,/O still/O with/O the/O same/O expression/O./O

``/OVery/O well/O!/O But/O I/O expect/O a/O strict/O observance/O of/O the/O external/O forms/O of/O
propriety/O till/O such/O time/O''/O--/Ohis/O voice/O shook/O--/O``/Oas/O I/O may/O take/O measures/O to/O
secure/O my/O honor/O and/O communicate/O them/O to/O you/O./O''/O

He/O got/O out/O first/O and/O helped/O her/O to/O get/O out/O./O Before/O the/O servants/O he/O
pressed/O her/O hand/O,/O took/O his/O seat/O in/O the/O carriage/O,/O and/O drove/O back/O to/O
Petersburg/LOCATION./O Immediately/O afterwards/O a/O footman/O came/O from/O Princess/O Betsy/PERSON
and/O brought/O Anna/PERSON a/O note/O./O

``/OI/O sent/O to/O Alexey/PERSON to/O find/O out/O how/O he/O is/O,/O and/O he/O writes/O me/O he/O is/O quite/O
well/O and/O unhurt/O,/O but/O in/O despair/O./O''/O

``/OSo/O _/Ohe/O_/O will/O be/O here/O,/O''/O she/O thought/O./O ``/OWhat/O a/O good/O thing/O I/O told/O him/O all/O!/O''/O

She/O glanced/O at/O her/O watch/O./O She/O had/O still/O three/O hours/O to/O wait/O,/O and/O the/O
memories/O of/O their/O last/O meeting/O set/O her/O blood/O in/O flame/O./O

``/OMy/O God/O,/O how/O light/O it/O is/O!/O It/O's/O dreadful/O,/O but/O I/O do/O love/O to/O see/O his/O face/O,/O
and/O I/O do/O love/O this/O fantastic/O light/O.../O./O My/O husband/O!/O Oh/O!/O yes/O.../O./O Well/O,/O
thank/O God/O!/O everything/O's/O over/O with/O him/O./O''/O



Chapter/O 30/O


In/O the/O little/O German/O watering-place/O to/O which/O the/O Shtcherbatskys/O had/O
betaken/O themselves/O,/O as/O in/O all/O places/O indeed/O where/O people/O are/O gathered/O
together/O,/O the/O usual/O process/O,/O as/O it/O were/O,/O of/O the/O crystallization/O of/O
society/O went/O on/O,/O assigning/O to/O each/O member/O of/O that/O society/O a/O definite/O and/O
unalterable/O place/O./O Just/O as/O the/O particle/O of/O water/O in/O frost/O,/O definitely/O
and/O unalterably/O,/O takes/O the/O special/O form/O of/O the/O crystal/O of/O snow/O,/O so/O each/O
new/O person/O that/O arrived/O at/O the/O springs/O was/O at/O once/O placed/O in/O his/O special/O
place/O./O

_/OFürst/O_/O Shtcherbatsky/PERSON,/O _/Osammt/O Gemahlin/LOCATION und/O Tochter/O_/O,/O by/O the/O apartments/O
they/O took/O,/O and/O from/O their/O name/O and/O from/O the/O friends/O they/O made/O,/O were/O
immediately/O crystallized/O into/O a/O definite/O place/O marked/O out/O for/O them/O./O

There/O was/O visiting/O the/O watering-place/O that/O year/O a/O real/O German/O Fürstin/O,/O
in/O consequence/O of/O which/O the/O crystallizing/O process/O went/O on/O more/O
vigorously/O than/O ever/O./O Princess/O Shtcherbatskaya/PERSON wished/O,/O above/O everything/O,/O
to/O present/O her/O daughter/O to/O this/O German/O princess/O,/O and/O the/O day/O after/O their/O
arrival/O she/O duly/O performed/O this/O rite/O./O Kitty/PERSON made/O a/O low/O and/O graceful/O
curtsey/O in/O the/O _/Overy/O simple/O_/O,/O that/O is/O to/O say/O,/O very/O elegant/O frock/O that/O
had/O been/O ordered/O her/O from/O Paris/LOCATION./O The/O German/O princess/O said/O,/O ``/OI/O hope/O the/O
roses/O will/O soon/O come/O back/O to/O this/O pretty/O little/O face/O,/O''/O and/O for/O the/O
Shtcherbatskys/O certain/O definite/O lines/O of/O existence/O were/O at/O once/O laid/O
down/O from/O which/O there/O was/O no/O departing/O./O The/O Shtcherbatskys/PERSON made/O the/O
acquaintance/O too/O of/O the/O family/O of/O an/O English/O Lady/O Somebody/O,/O and/O of/O a/O
German/O countess/O and/O her/O son/O,/O wounded/O in/O the/O last/O war/O,/O and/O of/O a/O learned/O
Swede/O,/O and/O of/O M./PERSON Canut/PERSON and/O his/O sister/O./O But/O yet/O inevitably/O the/O
Shtcherbatskys/O were/O thrown/O most/O into/O the/O society/O of/O a/O Moscow/LOCATION lady/O,/O Marya/PERSON
Yevgenyevna/PERSON Rtishtcheva/PERSON and/O her/O daughter/O,/O whom/O Kitty/PERSON disliked/O,/O because/O
she/O had/O fallen/O ill/O,/O like/O herself/O,/O over/O a/O love/O affair/O,/O and/O a/O Moscow/LOCATION
colonel/O,/O whom/O Kitty/PERSON had/O known/O from/O childhood/O,/O and/O always/O seen/O in/O uniform/O
and/O epaulets/O,/O and/O who/O now/O,/O with/O his/O little/O eyes/O and/O his/O open/O neck/O and/O
flowered/O cravat/O,/O was/O uncommonly/O ridiculous/O and/O tedious/O,/O because/O there/O
was/O no/O getting/O rid/O of/O him/O./O When/O all/O this/O was/O so/O firmly/O established/O,/O
Kitty/PERSON began/O to/O be/O very/O much/O bored/O,/O especially/O as/O the/O prince/O went/O away/O to/O
Carlsbad/LOCATION and/O she/O was/O left/O alone/O with/O her/O mother/O./O She/O took/O no/O interest/O in/O
the/O people/O she/O knew/O,/O feeling/O that/O nothing/O fresh/O would/O come/O of/O them/O./O Her/O
chief/O mental/O interest/O in/O the/O watering-place/O consisted/O in/O watching/O and/O
making/O theories/O about/O the/O people/O she/O did/O not/O know/O./O It/O was/O characteristic/O
of/O Kitty/PERSON that/O she/O always/O imagined/O everything/O in/O people/O in/O the/O most/O
favorable/O light/O possible/O,/O especially/O so/O in/O those/O she/O did/O not/O know/O./O And/O
now/O as/O she/O made/O surmises/O as/O to/O who/O people/O were/O,/O what/O were/O their/O
relations/O to/O one/O another/O,/O and/O what/O they/O were/O like/O,/O Kitty/PERSON endowed/O them/O
with/O the/O most/O marvelous/O and/O noble/O characters/O,/O and/O found/O confirmation/O of/O
her/O idea/O in/O her/O observations/O./O

Of/O these/O people/O the/O one/O that/O attracted/O her/O most/O was/O a/O Russian/O girl/O who/O
had/O come/O to/O the/O watering-place/O with/O an/O invalid/O Russian/O lady/O,/O Madame/PERSON
Stahl/PERSON,/O as/O everyone/O called/O her/O./O Madame/O Stahl/PERSON belonged/O to/O the/O highest/O
society/O,/O but/O she/O was/O so/O ill/O that/O she/O could/O not/O walk/O,/O and/O only/O on/O
exceptionally/O fine/O days/O made/O her/O appearance/O at/O the/O springs/O in/O an/O invalid/O
carriage/O./O But/O it/O was/O not/O so/O much/O from/O ill-health/O as/O from/O pride/O--/Oso/O
Princess/O Shtcherbatskaya/PERSON interpreted/O it/O--/Othat/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON had/O not/O made/O
the/O acquaintance/O of/O anyone/O among/O the/O Russians/O there/O./O The/O Russian/O girl/O
looked/O after/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON,/O and/O besides/O that/O,/O she/O was/O,/O as/O Kitty/PERSON observed/O,/O
on/O friendly/O terms/O with/O all/O the/O invalids/O who/O were/O seriously/O ill/O,/O and/O
there/O were/O many/O of/O them/O at/O the/O springs/O,/O and/O looked/O after/O them/O in/O the/O
most/O natural/O way/O./O This/O Russian/O girl/O was/O not/O,/O as/O Kitty/PERSON gathered/O,/O related/O
to/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON,/O nor/O was/O she/O a/O paid/O attendant/O./O Madame/O Stahl/PERSON called/O her/O
Varenka/LOCATION,/O and/O other/O people/O called/O her/O ``/OMademoiselle/PERSON Varenka/PERSON./O''/O Apart/O from/O
the/O interest/O Kitty/PERSON took/O in/O this/O girl/O's/O relations/O with/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON and/O
with/O other/O unknown/O persons/O,/O Kitty/PERSON,/O as/O often/O happened/O,/O felt/O an/O
inexplicable/O attraction/O to/O Mademoiselle/PERSON Varenka/PERSON,/O and/O was/O aware/O when/O
their/O eyes/O met/O that/O she/O too/O liked/O her/O./O

Of/O Mademoiselle/PERSON Varenka/PERSON one/O would/O not/O say/O that/O she/O had/O passed/O her/O first/O
youth/O,/O but/O she/O was/O,/O as/O it/O were/O,/O a/O creature/O without/O youth/O;/O she/O might/O have/O
been/O taken/O for/O nineteen/O or/O for/O thirty/O./O If/O her/O features/O were/O criticized/O
separately/O,/O she/O was/O handsome/O rather/O than/O plain/O,/O in/O spite/O of/O the/O sickly/O
hue/O of/O her/O face/O./O She/O would/O have/O been/O a/O good/O figure/O,/O too/O,/O if/O it/O had/O not/O
been/O for/O her/O extreme/O thinness/O and/O the/O size/O of/O her/O head/O,/O which/O was/O too/O
large/O for/O her/O medium/O height/O./O But/O she/O was/O not/O likely/O to/O be/O attractive/O to/O
men/O./O She/O was/O like/O a/O fine/O flower/O,/O already/O past/O its/O bloom/O and/O without/O
fragrance/O,/O though/O the/O petals/O were/O still/O unwithered/O./O Moreover/O,/O she/O would/O
have/O been/O unattractive/O to/O men/O also/O from/O the/O lack/O of/O just/O what/O Kitty/PERSON had/O
too/O much/O of/O--/Oof/O the/O suppressed/O fire/O of/O vitality/O,/O and/O the/O consciousness/O of/O
her/O own/O attractiveness/O./O

She/O always/O seemed/O absorbed/O in/O work/O about/O which/O there/O could/O be/O no/O doubt/O,/O
and/O so/O it/O seemed/O she/O could/O not/O take/O interest/O in/O anything/O outside/O it/O./O It/O
was/O just/O this/O contrast/O with/O her/O own/O position/O that/O was/O for/O Kitty/PERSON the/O
great/O attraction/O of/O Mademoiselle/LOCATION Varenka/LOCATION./O Kitty/PERSON felt/O that/O in/O her/O,/O in/O her/O
manner/O of/O life/O,/O she/O would/O find/O an/O example/O of/O what/O she/O was/O now/O so/O
painfully/O seeking/O:/O interest/O in/O life/O,/O a/O dignity/O in/O life/O--/Oapart/O from/O the/O
worldly/O relations/O of/O girls/O with/O men/O,/O which/O so/O revolted/O Kitty/PERSON,/O and/O
appeared/O to/O her/O now/O as/O a/O shameful/O hawking/O about/O of/O goods/O in/O search/O of/O a/O
purchaser/O./O The/O more/O attentively/O Kitty/PERSON watched/O her/O unknown/O friend/O,/O the/O
more/O convinced/O she/O was/O this/O girl/O was/O the/O perfect/O creature/O she/O fancied/O
her/O,/O and/O the/O more/O eagerly/O she/O wished/O to/O make/O her/O acquaintance/O./O

The/O two/O girls/O used/O to/O meet/O several/O times/O a/O day/O,/O and/O every/O time/O they/O met/O,/O
Kitty/PERSON's/O eyes/O said/O:/O ``/OWho/O are/O you/O?/O What/O are/O you/O?/O Are/O you/O really/O the/O
exquisite/O creature/O I/O imagine/O you/O to/O be/O?/O But/O for/O goodness/O'/O sake/O do/On't/O
suppose/O,/O''/O her/O eyes/O added/O,/O ``/Othat/O I/O would/O force/O my/O acquaintance/O on/O you/O,/O I/O
simply/O admire/O you/O and/O like/O you/O./O''/O ``/OI/O like/O you/O too/O,/O and/O you/O're/O very/O,/O very/O
sweet/O./O And/O I/O should/O like/O you/O better/O still/O,/O if/O I/O had/O time/O,/O''/O answered/O the/O
eyes/O of/O the/O unknown/O girl/O./O Kitty/PERSON saw/O indeed/O,/O that/O she/O was/O always/O busy/O./O
Either/O she/O was/O taking/O the/O children/O of/O a/O Russian/O family/O home/O from/O the/O
springs/O,/O or/O fetching/O a/O shawl/O for/O a/O sick/O lady/O,/O and/O wrapping/O her/O up/O in/O it/O,/O
or/O trying/O to/O interest/O an/O irritable/O invalid/O,/O or/O selecting/O and/O buying/O
cakes/O for/O tea/O for/O someone/O./O

Soon/O after/O the/O arrival/O of/O the/O Shtcherbatskys/O there/O appeared/O in/O the/O
morning/O crowd/O at/O the/O springs/O two/O persons/O who/O attracted/O universal/O and/O
unfavorable/O attention/O./O These/O were/O a/O tall/O man/O with/O a/O stooping/O figure/O,/O and/O
huge/O hands/O,/O in/O an/O old/O coat/O too/O short/O for/O him/O,/O with/O black/O,/O simple/O,/O and/O
yet/O terrible/O eyes/O,/O and/O a/O pockmarked/O,/O kind-looking/O woman/O,/O very/O badly/O and/O
tastelessly/O dressed/O./O Recognizing/O these/O persons/O as/O Russians/O,/O Kitty/PERSON had/O
already/O in/O her/O imagination/O begun/O constructing/O a/O delightful/O and/O touching/O
romance/O about/O them/O./O But/O the/O princess/O,/O having/O ascertained/O from/O the/O
visitors/O'/O list/O that/O this/O was/O Nikolay/PERSON Levin/PERSON and/O Marya/PERSON Nikolaevna/PERSON,/O
explained/O to/O Kitty/PERSON what/O a/O bad/O man/O this/O Levin/PERSON was/O,/O and/O all/O her/O fancies/O
about/O these/O two/O people/O vanished/O./O Not/O so/O much/O from/O what/O her/O mother/O told/O
her/O,/O as/O from/O the/O fact/O that/O it/O was/O Konstantin/PERSON's/O brother/O,/O this/O pair/O
suddenly/O seemed/O to/O Kitty/PERSON intensely/O unpleasant/O./O This/O Levin/PERSON,/O with/O his/O
continual/O twitching/O of/O his/O head/O,/O aroused/O in/O her/O now/O an/O irrepressible/O
feeling/O of/O disgust/O./O

It/O seemed/O to/O her/O that/O his/O big/O,/O terrible/O eyes/O,/O which/O persistently/O pursued/O
her/O,/O expressed/O a/O feeling/O of/O hatred/O and/O contempt/O,/O and/O she/O tried/O to/O avoid/O
meeting/O him/O./O



Chapter/O 31/O


It/O was/O a/O wet/O day/O;/O it/O had/O been/O raining/O all/O the/O morning/O,/O and/O the/O invalids/O,/O
with/O their/O parasols/O,/O had/O flocked/O into/O the/O arcades/O./O

Kitty/PERSON was/O walking/O there/O with/O her/O mother/O and/O the/O Moscow/LOCATION colonel/O,/O smart/O
and/O jaunty/O in/O his/O European/O coat/O,/O bought/O ready-made/O at/O Frankfort/LOCATION./O They/O
were/O walking/O on/O one/O side/O of/O the/O arcade/O,/O trying/O to/O avoid/O Levin/PERSON,/O who/O was/O
walking/O on/O the/O other/O side/O./O Varenka/PERSON,/O in/O her/O dark/O dress/O,/O in/O a/O black/O hat/O
with/O a/O turn-down/O brim/O,/O was/O walking/O up/O and/O down/O the/O whole/O length/O of/O the/O
arcade/O with/O a/O blind/O Frenchwoman/O,/O and/O,/O every/O time/O she/O met/O Kitty/PERSON,/O they/O
exchanged/O friendly/O glances/O./O

``/OMamma/O,/O could/On't/O I/O speak/O to/O her/O?/O''/O said/O Kitty/PERSON,/O watching/O her/O unknown/O
friend/O,/O and/O noticing/O that/O she/O was/O going/O up/O to/O the/O spring/O,/O and/O that/O they/O
might/O come/O there/O together/O./O

``/OOh/O,/O if/O you/O want/O to/O so/O much/O,/O I/O'll/O find/O out/O about/O her/O first/O and/O make/O her/O
acquaintance/O myself/O,/O''/O answered/O her/O mother/O./O ``/OWhat/O do/O you/O see/O in/O her/O out/O
of/O the/O way/O?/O A/O companion/O,/O she/O must/O be/O./O If/O you/O like/O,/O I/O'll/O make/O
acquaintance/O with/O Madame/O Stahl/O;/O I/O used/O to/O know/O her/O _/Obelle-soeur/O_/O,/O''/O added/O
the/O princess/O,/O lifting/O her/O head/O haughtily/O./O

Kitty/PERSON knew/O that/O the/O princess/O was/O offended/O that/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON had/O seemed/O
to/O avoid/O making/O her/O acquaintance/O./O Kitty/PERSON did/O not/O insist/O./O

``/OHow/O wonderfully/O sweet/O she/O is/O!/O''/O she/O said/O,/O gazing/O at/O Varenka/LOCATION just/O as/O she/O
handed/O a/O glass/O to/O the/O Frenchwoman/O./O ``/OLook/O how/O natural/O and/O sweet/O it/O all/O
is/O./O''/O

``/OIt/O's/O so/O funny/O to/O see/O your/O _/Oengouements/O_/O,/O''/O said/O the/O princess/O./O ``/ONo/O,/O we/O'd/O
better/O go/O back/O,/O''/O she/O added/O,/O noticing/O Levin/PERSON coming/O towards/O them/O with/O his/O
companion/O and/O a/O German/O doctor/O,/O to/O whom/O he/O was/O talking/O very/O noisily/O and/O
angrily/O./O

They/O turned/O to/O go/O back/O,/O when/O suddenly/O they/O heard/O,/O not/O noisy/O talk/O,/O but/O
shouting/O./O Levin/PERSON,/O stopping/O short/O,/O was/O shouting/O at/O the/O doctor/O,/O and/O the/O
doctor/O,/O too/O,/O was/O excited/O./O A/O crowd/O gathered/O about/O them/O./O The/O princess/O and/O
Kitty/PERSON beat/O a/O hasty/O retreat/O,/O while/O the/O colonel/O joined/O the/O crowd/O to/O find/O
out/O what/O was/O the/O matter/O./O

A/O few/O minutes/O later/O the/O colonel/O overtook/O them/O./O

``/OWhat/O was/O it/O?/O''/O inquired/O the/O princess/O./O

``/OScandalous/O and/O disgraceful/O!/O''/O answered/O the/O colonel/O./O ``/OThe/O one/O thing/O to/O be/O
dreaded/O is/O meeting/O Russians/O abroad/O./O That/O tall/O gentleman/O was/O abusing/O the/O
doctor/O,/O flinging/O all/O sorts/O of/O insults/O at/O him/O because/O he/O was/On't/O treating/O
him/O quite/O as/O he/O liked/O,/O and/O he/O began/O waving/O his/O stick/O at/O him/O./O It/O's/O simply/O
a/O scandal/O!/O''/O

``/OOh/O,/O how/O unpleasant/O!/O''/O said/O the/O princess/O./O ``/OWell/O,/O and/O how/O did/O it/O end/O?/O''/O

``/OLuckily/O at/O that/O point/O that/O .../O the/O one/O in/O the/O mushroom/O hat/O .../O
intervened/O./O A/O Russian/O lady/O,/O I/O think/O she/O is/O,/O''/O said/O the/O colonel/O./O

``/OMademoiselle/PERSON Varenka/PERSON?/O''/O asked/O Kitty/PERSON./O

``/OYes/O,/O yes/O./O She/O came/O to/O the/O rescue/O before/O anyone/O;/O she/O took/O the/O man/O by/O the/O
arm/O and/O led/O him/O away/O./O''/O

``/OThere/O,/O mamma/O,/O''/O said/O Kitty/PERSON;/O ``/Oyou/O wonder/O that/O I/O'm/O enthusiastic/O about/O
her/O./O''/O

The/O next/O day/O,/O as/O she/O watched/O her/O unknown/O friend/O,/O Kitty/PERSON noticed/O that/O
Mademoiselle/PERSON Varenka/PERSON was/O already/O on/O the/O same/O terms/O with/O Levin/PERSON and/O his/O
companion/O as/O with/O her/O other/O _/Oprotégés/O_/O./O She/O went/O up/O to/O them/O,/O entered/O
into/O conversation/O with/O them/O,/O and/O served/O as/O interpreter/O for/O the/O woman/O,/O
who/O could/O not/O speak/O any/O foreign/O language/O./O

Kitty/PERSON began/O to/O entreat/O her/O mother/O still/O more/O urgently/O to/O let/O her/O make/O
friends/O with/O Varenka/LOCATION./O And/O,/O disagreeable/O as/O it/O was/O to/O the/O princess/O to/O
seem/O to/O take/O the/O first/O step/O in/O wishing/O to/O make/O the/O acquaintance/O of/O
Madame/O Stahl/PERSON,/O who/O thought/O fit/O to/O give/O herself/O airs/O,/O she/O made/O inquiries/O
about/O Varenka/LOCATION,/O and/O,/O having/O ascertained/O particulars/O about/O her/O tending/O to/O
prove/O that/O there/O could/O be/O no/O harm/O though/O little/O good/O in/O the/O
acquaintance/O,/O she/O herself/O approached/O Varenka/PERSON and/O made/O acquaintance/O with/O
her/O./O

Choosing/O a/O time/O when/O her/O daughter/O had/O gone/O to/O the/O spring/O,/O while/O Varenka/PERSON
had/O stopped/O outside/O the/O baker/O's/O,/O the/O princess/O went/O up/O to/O her/O./O

``/OAllow/O me/O to/O make/O your/O acquaintance/O,/O''/O she/O said/O,/O with/O her/O dignified/O
smile/O./O ``/OMy/O daughter/O has/O lost/O her/O heart/O to/O you/O,/O''/O she/O said/O./O ``/OPossibly/O you/O
do/O not/O know/O me/O./O I/O am/O.../O''/O

``/OThat/O feeling/O is/O more/O than/O reciprocal/O,/O princess/O,/O''/O Varenka/PERSON answered/O
hurriedly/O./O

``/OWhat/O a/O good/O deed/O you/O did/O yesterday/O to/O our/O poor/O compatriot/O!/O''/O said/O the/O
princess/O./O

Varenka/PERSON flushed/O a/O little/O./O ``/OI/O do/On't/O remember/O./O I/O do/On't/O think/O I/O did/O
anything/O,/O''/O she/O said/O./O

``/OWhy/O,/O you/O saved/O that/O Levin/PERSON from/O disagreeable/O consequences/O./O''/O

``/OYes/O,/O _/Osa/O compagne/O_/O called/O me/O,/O and/O I/O tried/O to/O pacify/O him/O,/O he/O's/O very/O ill/O,/O
and/O was/O dissatisfied/O with/O the/O doctor/O./O I/O'm/O used/O to/O looking/O after/O such/O
invalids/O./O''/O

``/OYes/O,/O I/O've/O heard/O you/O live/O at/O Mentone/LOCATION with/O your/O aunt/O--/OI/O think/O--/OMadame/O
Stahl/O:/O I/O used/O to/O know/O her/O _/Obelle-soeur/O_/O./O''/O

``/ONo/O,/O she/O's/O not/O my/O aunt/O./O I/O call/O her/O mamma/O,/O but/O I/O am/O not/O related/O to/O her/O;/O I/O
was/O brought/O up/O by/O her/O,/O''/O answered/O Varenka/PERSON,/O flushing/O a/O little/O again/O./O

This/O was/O so/O simply/O said/O,/O and/O so/O sweet/O was/O the/O truthful/O and/O candid/O
expression/O of/O her/O face/O,/O that/O the/O princess/O saw/O why/O Kitty/PERSON had/O taken/O such/O a/O
fancy/O to/O Varenka/LOCATION./O

``/OWell/O,/O and/O what/O's/O this/O Levin/PERSON going/O to/O do/O?/O''/O asked/O the/O princess/O./O

``/OHe/O's/O going/O away/O,/O''/O answered/O Varenka/PERSON./O

At/O that/O instant/O Kitty/PERSON came/O up/O from/O the/O spring/O beaming/O with/O delight/O that/O
her/O mother/O had/O become/O acquainted/O with/O her/O unknown/O friend/O./O

``/OWell/O,/O see/O,/O Kitty/PERSON,/O your/O intense/O desire/O to/O make/O friends/O with/O
Mademoiselle/PERSON.../O''/O

``/OVarenka/O,/O''/O Varenka/PERSON put/O in/O smiling/O,/O ``/Othat/O's/O what/O everyone/O calls/O me/O./O''/O

Kitty/PERSON blushed/O with/O pleasure/O,/O and/O slowly/O,/O without/O speaking/O,/O pressed/O her/O
new/O friend/O's/O hand/O,/O which/O did/O not/O respond/O to/O her/O pressure/O,/O but/O lay/O
motionless/O in/O her/O hand/O./O The/O hand/O did/O not/O respond/O to/O her/O pressure/O,/O but/O
the/O face/O of/O Mademoiselle/PERSON Varenka/PERSON glowed/O with/O a/O soft/O,/O glad/O,/O though/O rather/O
mournful/O smile/O,/O that/O showed/O large/O but/O handsome/O teeth/O./O

``/OI/O have/O long/O wished/O for/O this/O too/O,/O''/O she/O said/O./O

``/OBut/O you/O are/O so/O busy/O./O''/O

``/OOh/O,/O no/O,/O I/O'm/O not/O at/O all/O busy/O,/O''/O answered/O Varenka/PERSON,/O but/O at/O that/O moment/O she/O
had/O to/O leave/O her/O new/O friends/O because/O two/O little/O Russian/O girls/O,/O children/O
of/O an/O invalid/O,/O ran/O up/O to/O her/O./O

``/OVarenka/O,/O mamma/O's/O calling/O!/O''/O they/O cried/O./O

And/O Varenka/PERSON went/O after/O them/O./O



Chapter/O 32/O


The/O particulars/O which/O the/O princess/O had/O learned/O in/O regard/O to/O Varenka/LOCATION's/O
past/O and/O her/O relations/O with/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON were/O as/O follows/O:/O

Madame/O Stahl/O,/O of/O whom/O some/O people/O said/O that/O she/O had/O worried/O her/O husband/O
out/O of/O his/O life/O,/O while/O others/O said/O it/O was/O he/O who/O had/O made/O her/O wretched/O
by/O his/O immoral/O behavior/O,/O had/O always/O been/O a/O woman/O of/O weak/O health/O and/O
enthusiastic/O temperament/O./O When/O,/O after/O her/O separation/O from/O her/O husband/O,/O
she/O gave/O birth/O to/O her/O only/O child/O,/O the/O child/O had/O died/O almost/O immediately/O,/O
and/O the/O family/O of/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON,/O knowing/O her/O sensibility/O,/O and/O fearing/O the/O
news/O would/O kill/O her/O,/O had/O substituted/O another/O child/O,/O a/O baby/O born/O the/O same/O
night/O and/O in/O the/O same/O house/O in/O Petersburg/LOCATION,/O the/O daughter/O of/O the/O chief/O
cook/O of/O the/O Imperial/ORGANIZATION Household/ORGANIZATION./O This/O was/O Varenka/LOCATION./O Madame/O Stahl/PERSON learned/O
later/O on/O that/O Varenka/PERSON was/O not/O her/O own/O child/O,/O but/O she/O went/O on/O bringing/O
her/O up/O,/O especially/O as/O very/O soon/O afterwards/O Varenka/PERSON had/O not/O a/O relation/O of/O
her/O own/O living/O./O Madame/O Stahl/PERSON had/O now/O been/O living/O more/O than/O ten/O years/O
continuously/O abroad/O,/O in/O the/O south/O,/O never/O leaving/O her/O couch/O./O And/O some/O
people/O said/O that/O Madame/PERSON Stahl/PERSON had/O made/O her/O social/O position/O as/O a/O
philanthropic/O,/O highly/O religious/O woman/O;/O other/O people/O said/O she/O really/O was/O
at/O heart/O the/O highly/O ethical/O being/O,/O living/O for/O nothing/O but/O the/O good/O of/O
her/O fellow/O creatures/O,/O which/O she/O represented/O herself/O to/O be/O./O No/O one/O knew/O
what/O her/O faith/O was/O--/OCatholic/O,/O Protestant/O,/O or/O Orthodox/O./O But/O one/O fact/O was/O
indubitable/O--/Oshe/O was/O in/O amicable/O relations/O with/O the/O highest/O dignitaries/O
of/O all/O the/O churches/O and/O sects/O./O

Varenka/PERSON lived/O with/O her/O all/O the/O while/O abroad/O,/O and/O everyone/O who/O knew/O
Madame/ORGANIZATION Stahl/ORGANIZATION knew/O and/O liked/O Mademoiselle/PERSON Varenka/PERSON,/O as/O everyone/O called/O
her/O./O

Having/O learned/O all/O these/O facts/O,/O the/O princess/O found/O nothing/O to/O object/O to/O
in/O her/O daughter/O's/O intimacy/O with/O Varenka/PERSON,/O more/O especially/O as/O Varenka/PERSON's/O
breeding/O and/O education/O were/O of/O the/O best/O--/Oshe/O spoke/O French/O and/O English/O
extremely/O well/O--/Oand/O what/O was/O of/O the/O most/O weight/O,/O brought/O a/O message/O from/O
Madame/O Stahl/O expressing/O her/O regret/O that/O she/O was/O prevented/O by/O her/O ill/O
health/O from/O making/O the/O acquaintance/O of/O the/O princess/O./O

After/O getting/O to/O know/O Varenka/LOCATION,/O Kitty/PERSON became/O more/O and/O more/O fascinated/O by/O
her/O friend/O,/O and/O every/O day/O she/O discovered/O new/O virtues/O in/O her/O./O

The/O princess/O,/O hearing/O that/O Varenka/PERSON had/O a/O good/O voice/O,/O asked/O her/O to/O come/O
and/O sing/O to/O them/O in/O the/O evening/O./O

``/OKitty/PERSON plays/O,/O and/O we/O have/O a/O piano/O;/O not/O a/O good/O one/O,/O it/O's/O true/O,/O but/O you/O
will/O give/O us/O so/O much/O pleasure/O,/O''/O said/O the/O princess/O with/O her/O affected/O
smile/O,/O which/O Kitty/PERSON disliked/O particularly/O just/O then/O,/O because/O she/O noticed/O
that/O Varenka/PERSON had/O no/O inclination/O to/O sing/O./O Varenka/O came/O,/O however/O,/O in/O the/O
evening/O and/O brought/O a/O roll/O of/O music/O with/O her/O./O The/O princess/O had/O invited/O
Marya/PERSON Yevgenyevna/PERSON and/O her/O daughter/O and/O the/O colonel/O./O

Varenka/PERSON seemed/O quite/O unaffected/O by/O there/O being/O persons/O present/O she/O did/O
not/O know/O,/O and/O she/O went/O directly/O to/O the/O piano/O./O She/O could/O not/O accompany/O
herself/O,/O but/O she/O could/O sing/O music/O at/O sight/O very/O well/O./O Kitty/PERSON,/O who/O played/O
well/O,/O accompanied/O her/O./O

``/OYou/O have/O an/O extraordinary/O talent/O,/O''/O the/O princess/O said/O to/O her/O after/O
Varenka/PERSON had/O sung/O the/O first/O song/O extremely/O well/O./O

Marya/PERSON Yevgenyevna/PERSON and/O her/O daughter/O expressed/O their/O thanks/O and/O
admiration/O./O

``/OLook/O,/O''/O said/O the/O colonel/O,/O looking/O out/O of/O the/O window/O,/O ``/Owhat/O an/O audience/O
has/O collected/O to/O listen/O to/O you/O./O''/O There/O actually/O was/O quite/O a/O considerable/O
crowd/O under/O the/O windows/O./O

``/OI/O am/O very/O glad/O it/O gives/O you/O pleasure/O,/O''/O Varenka/PERSON answered/O simply/O./O

Kitty/PERSON looked/O with/O pride/O at/O her/O friend/O./O She/O was/O enchanted/O by/O her/O talent/O,/O
and/O her/O voice/O,/O and/O her/O face/O,/O but/O most/O of/O all/O by/O her/O manner/O,/O by/O the/O way/O
Varenka/O obviously/O thought/O nothing/O of/O her/O singing/O and/O was/O quite/O unmoved/O
by/O their/O praises/O./O She/O seemed/O only/O to/O be/O asking/O:/O ``/OAm/O I/O to/O sing/O again/O,/O or/O
is/O that/O enough/O?/O''/O

``/OIf/O it/O had/O been/O I/O,/O''/O thought/O Kitty/PERSON,/O ``/Ohow/O proud/O I/O should/O have/O been/O!/O How/O
delighted/O I/O should/O have/O been/O to/O see/O that/O crowd/O under/O the/O windows/O!/O But/O
she/O's/O utterly/O unmoved/O by/O it/O./O Her/O only/O motive/O is/O to/O avoid/O refusing/O and/O to/O
please/O mamma/O./O What/O is/O there/O in/O her/O?/O What/O is/O it/O gives/O her/O the/O power/O to/O
look/O down/O on/O everything/O,/O to/O be/O calm/O independently/O of/O everything/O?/O How/O I/O
should/O like/O to/O know/O it/O and/O to/O learn/O it/O of/O her/O!/O''/O thought/O Kitty/PERSON,/O gazing/O
into/O her/O serene/O face/O./O The/O princess/O asked/O Varenka/PERSON to/O sing/O again/O,/O and/O
Varenka/PERSON sang/O another/O song/O,/O also/O smoothly/O,/O distinctly/O,/O and/O well/O,/O standing/O
erect/O at/O the/O piano/O and/O beating/O time/O on/O it/O with/O her/O thin/O,/O dark-skinned/O
hand/O./O

The/O next/O song/O in/O the/O book/O was/O an/O Italian/O one/O./O Kitty/PERSON played/O the/O opening/O
bars/O,/O and/O looked/O round/O at/O Varenka/LOCATION./O

``/OLet/O's/O skip/O that/O,/O''/O said/O Varenka/PERSON,/O flushing/O a/O little/O./O Kitty/PERSON let/O her/O eyes/O
rest/O on/O Varenka/PERSON's/O face/O,/O with/O a/O look/O of/O dismay/O and/O inquiry/O./O

``/OVery/O well/O,/O the/O next/O one/O,/O''/O she/O said/O hurriedly/O,/O turning/O over/O the/O pages/O,/O
and/O at/O once/O feeling/O that/O there/O was/O something/O connected/O with/O the/O song/O./O

``/ONo/O,/O''/O answered/O Varenka/PERSON with/O a/O smile/O,/O laying/O her/O hand/O on/O the/O music/O,/O ``/Ono/O,/O
let/O's/O have/O that/O one/O./O''/O And/O she/O sang/O it/O just/O as/O quietly/O,/O as/O coolly/O,/O and/O as/O
well/O as/O the/O others/O./O

When/O she/O had/O finished/O,/O they/O all/O thanked/O her/O again/O,/O and/O went/O off/O to/O tea/O./O
Kitty/PERSON and/O Varenka/LOCATION went/O out/O into/O the/O little/O garden/O that/O adjoined/O the/O
house/O./O

``/OAm/O I/O right/O,/O that/O you/O have/O some/O reminiscences/O connected/O with/O that/O song/O?/O''/O
said/O Kitty/PERSON./O ``/ODo/On't/O tell/O me/O,/O''/O she/O added/O hastily/O,/O ``/Oonly/O say/O if/O I/O'm/O right/O./O''/O

``/ONo/O,/O why/O not/O?/O I/O'll/O tell/O you/O simply/O,/O''/O said/O Varenka/PERSON,/O and/O,/O without/O waiting/O
for/O a/O reply/O,/O she/O went/O on/O:/O ``/OYes/O,/O it/O brings/O up/O memories/O,/O once/O painful/O
ones/O./O I/O cared/O for/O someone/O once/O,/O and/O I/O used/O to/O sing/O him/O that/O song/O./O''/O

Kitty/PERSON with/O big/O,/O wide-open/O eyes/O gazed/O silently/O,/O sympathetically/O at/O
Varenka/LOCATION./O

``/OI/O cared/O for/O him/O,/O and/O he/O cared/O for/O me/O;/O but/O his/O mother/O did/O not/O wish/O it/O,/O
and/O he/O married/O another/O girl/O./O He/O's/O living/O now/O not/O far/O from/O us/O,/O and/O I/O see/O
him/O sometimes/O./O You/O did/On't/O think/O I/O had/O a/O love/O story/O too/O,/O''/O she/O said/O,/O and/O
there/O was/O a/O faint/O gleam/O in/O her/O handsome/O face/O of/O that/O fire/O which/O Kitty/PERSON
